intro: Cacalia fuscopilosa, commonly known as the dark-haired cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
